title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 104.4 - Waterfowl hunting
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 104.4 - Waterfowl hunting

State Regulations
(a) Persons who hunt waterfowl on the area during the first five days of the duck
hunting season must be in possession of a daily Bashakill WMA waterfowl hunting
permit issued to them by the department. (b) Persons who hunt waterfowl on the area
after the first five days of the duck hunting season, or during any other
waterfowl hunting season, must be in possession of a permanent Bashakill WMA
waterfowl hunting permit issued to them by the department. A permanent

Bashakill WMA waterfowl hunting permit is not valid during the first five days
of the duck hunting season. (c) Applications for Daily Bashakill WMA waterfowl hunting permits shall be
submitted in writing and postmarked between (and including) August 1st and

September 1st to the Regional Wildlife Manager, Department of Environmental

Conservation, 21 South Putt Corners Road, New Paltz, New York 12561. No more
than three persons may apply on the same application. Applications must be on a
post card or 3 x 5 index card. Applications must include name, address, telephone number, a current hunting license stamp number, which day(s) they are
requesting a permit, and a waterfowl identification certificate number. Applicants are required to have successfully completed a certified course in
waterfowl identification. Applicants should indicate their preference for
hunting in the North Zone (defined as the portion of the Bashakill WMA north of

Haven Road) or South Zone (defined as the portion of the Bashakill WMA south of

Haven Road.)
(d) The quota of daily
permits to be issued for each zone shall be determined by the department each
year. (e) A preseason selection
will be held in September, at the Department of Environmental Conservation

Region 3 Headquarters in New Paltz, to select waterfowl hunters for the first
three days that waterfowl hunting will be allowed during the duck hunting
season. (f) Applications for

Permanent Bashakill WMA waterfowl hunting permits shall be submitted in writing
to the Regional Wildlife Manager, Department of Environmental Conservation, 21

South Putt Corners Road, New Paltz, NY 12561. Applications must include name, address, telephone number, and a current hunting license stamp
number. (g) Waterfowl hunting on
the area will be allowed on Saturday, Sunday, Tuesday and Thursday during the
first split of the duck hunting season as defined in section
2.30
of this Title. Hunting will be
allowed each day during the second split of the duck hunting season as defined
in section
2.30
of this Title. (h) Waterfowl hunting on the area will be
allowed between sunrise and noon during the first split of the duck hunting
season and between sunrise and sunset during the second split of the duck
hunting season as defined in section
2.30
of this Title. (i) Waterfowl hunters may enter the area no
earlier than two hours before sunrise and must leave the area by one-half hour
after noon, during the first split of the duck hunting season. (j) Waterfowl hunters shall use or possess
afield no more than 25 shells per day. (k) Waterfowl hunters must be equipped with
at least one of the following: hip boots, waders, a boat, or a retrieving
dog. (l) No person shall fail to
remove all personal equipment from the area, including spent shells, upon
completion of each day's hunt. (m) No person shall, while on the area, erect, occupy or hunt from a permanent
blind. (n) Consistently shooting at
waterfowl which are out of the effective killing range of the shotgun being
utilized is prohibited. (o) Bashakill WMA waterfowl hunting permits shall be valid only for the period and
location for which they are issued, and shall not be transferable. The
department may revoke a Bashakill waterfowl hunting permit at any
time. (p) Waterfowl hunters must
show their Bashakill WMA waterfowl hunting permit to anyone requesting to see
it. (q) The department may require
permittees to submit reports of their waterfowl hunting activities on forms
provided by the department. (r) The
department may refuse to issue a Bashakill WMA waterfowl hunting permit to
anyone, revoke a Bashakill WMA waterfowl hunting permit, or eject a person from
the area for failure to comply with the provisions of the Environmental

Conservation Law, hunting, fishing or trapping regulations established by the
department, or the regulations or conditions contained on special use
permits. Notes
